After decreasing `slowDBAccessThreshold`, I was able to receive slow sqls from the server, thanks for the hint. 

- I refactored component name as `mariadb-jdbc`.
- I am attaching a sample database dashboard screenshot.

![Screenshot 2020-05-06 at 19 49 24](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1737260/81216352-10c24b80-8fdb-11ea-9b58-6209c0e2f7b4.png)

~~The logo is for topology, you should see a question mark to represent the database node currently, yes?~~

Noticed and merged this PR, https://github.com/apache/skywalking-rocketbot-ui/pull/291

This is the build information for rockspec ``` build = { type = "builtin", modules = { ["skywalking.register"] = "lib/skywalking/register.lua", ["skywalking.segment_ref"] = "lib/skywalking/segment_ref.lua", ["skywalking.segment"] = "lib/skywalking/segment.lua", ["skywalking.span_layer"] = "lib/skywalking/span_layer.lua", ["skywalking.span"] = "lib/skywalking/span.lua", ["skywalking.tracing_context"] = "lib/skywalking/tracing_context.lua", ["skywalking.util"] = "lib/skywalking/util.lua", } } ``` But dir `library/skywalking` contains the following script: When `luarocks install` was run, I couldn't get all the scripts under the directory `library/skywalking`(*_test.lua can be ignore), Only the script specified in `rockspec.build` will be included
@moonming Could you take a look? Typically, I don't use in this way.
